How to create a custom github readme summary

How To: Create a GitHub Page Readme

Back in the day before search engines, when you wanted to make a website you had to go to someone elseâ€™s website, view source, and customize it for your own purposes. If you saw something kewl on a website you would view source and try to do it on your website. In this view source fashion I have learned how to make a GitHub Page Summary using a simple README.md markdown file.

Letâ€™s Get Started

Credit where credit is due: I found this original snippet from Clun. When I saw his github page I was very impressed the ability to customize that profile page. I was able to quickly figure out how he did it. All I had to do was copy the source:

### Hi This is Cedrick Lunven, Director of Developer Advocacy @DataStax

- ðŸ”­ Iâ€™m currently working on `FF4j` [ff4j.org](ff4j.org) and DataStax Sample applications
- ðŸŒ± Iâ€™m currently learning `React`, `Redux` and more `Javascript`
- ðŸ’¬ Ask me about `FF4j`, `NoSQL` databases
- ðŸ“« How to reach me: [@clunven](https://twitter.com/clunven) on twitter
- âš¡ **Fun fact:** *everything has an end except a sausage that has two ends*

Next I create the github profile repo (same repo name as my username) in my account, add the README.md source, and modify to suit my needs:

### Hi This is Steven Matison, Presales Data Architect @DataStax

- ðŸ”­ Iâ€™m currently working on Astra, NoSqlBench, & Stargate
- ðŸŒ± Iâ€™m currently learning Kubernetes, DSE Spark, DSE Graph 
- ðŸ’¬ Ask me about Astra, Cassandra, Stargate, Open Source, NiFi, Apache Software Foundation, Apis
- ðŸ‘¯ Iâ€™m looking to collaborate on NoSqlBench, NiFi, OpenSource 
- ðŸ“« How to reach me: [@DSMatison](https://twitter.com/DSMatison) on twitter
- âš¡ Check out my [GitHub Pages Datastax Journal](https://ds-steven-matison.github.io/)

Next I did this on my previous github so anyone finding me there can see all my current stuff here. Ty Cedric!!

Adding a Summary Page Counter

While crusing the internet today I ran into another Git Hub Users Tusharojha who had a page counter in his summary. I quickly viewed source, grabbed the code, modified my username, and added to README.md:

<img src="https://komarev.com/ghpvc/?username=ds-steven-matison" alt="ds-steven-matison" />

and viola it is now added it to my page. Ty Tushar!!
